@microsoft.graph.tips: Use $select to choose only the properties your app needs, as this can lead to performance improvements. For example: GET deviceManagement/reusableSettings?$select=accessTypes,applicability

value.description: Includes USB, Corporate, Network, Universal, File, Custom, or Local
value.name: PrinterConnectionId

value.description: Learn more about the printer protection primary ID
value.name: PrimaryId

value.description: When there are multiple device properties being used in the DescriptorIDList, MatchType defines the relationship.
value.name: MatchType

value.description: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint Device Control Removable Storage Protection allows you to restrict the removable storage access based on the properties.
value.name: DescriptorIdList

value.description: GUID, a unique ID, represents the group and will be used in the policy as GroupId.
value.name: Id

value.description: Four-digit product code that the vendor assigns to the device.
value.name: PID

value.description: Four-digit vendor code that the USB committee assigns to the vendor.
value.name: VID

value.description: Vendor ID is the four-digit vendor code that the USB committee assigns to the vendor. Product ID is the four-digit product code that the vendor assigns to the device; Support wildcard. For example. 0751_55E0
value.name: VID_PID

value.description: Vendor ID is the four-digit vendor code that the USB committee assigns to the vendor. Product ID is the four-digit product code that the vendor assigns to the device; Support wildcard.
value.name: VID_PID

value.description: A string identified the device in the system, for example, USBSTOR\DiskGeneric_Flash_Disk___8.07; Note: Hardware ID is not unique; different devices might share the same value.
value.name: HardwareId

value.description: A string uniquely identifies the device in the system, for example, USBSTOR\DISK&VEN_GENERIC&PROD_FLASH_DISK&REV_8.07\8735B611&0
value.name: InstancePathId

value.description: The Primary ID includes removable storage and CD/DVD and Windows Portable Device/WPD.
value.name: PrimaryId

value.description: A string that's attached to the device (the same string as the Friendly name in Device Manager). For example, Generic Flash Disk USB Device
value.name: FriendlyNameId

value.description: A string attached to the device, for example, Generic Flash Disk USB Device.
value.name: FriendlyNameId
